bow: my child is years months old is potty trained and can not talk what do do hi there would appreciate any and all guidance on this matter single mother of five boys the oldest being almost 17 my youngest child is turning in november all of my kids were late talkers including my youngest he can not communicate with me as much as other year olds do with their parents he can recognise peppa pig characters and amazingly he can navigate phone much better than my father in law however he never lets me know when he soiled his nappy and instead runs upstairs and lies down there he is going to nursery next wednesday and they will not admit any child that is not potty trained my other kids were potty trained at but this one is very stubborn over the past few weeks when he wearing nappies pullups he does tell me when he soiled them and he does want me to change them so today decided to potty train him and jump straight to underwear took out seven pairs of briefs and seven pairs of trousers and seven times he peed through his underwear and underwear in the living room my bedroom and showed no sign to me that he was either going to pee or he already peed each time got really annoyed and took him to the bathroom and made him sit there even though he was finished peeing and he would sit there crying and scratching his arms or knees my other kids want me to just put on his nappies and call it day should am being too stubborn with him that last thing would want is for him to be scared and reluctant to go to the toilet ve booked an appointment with health visitor on tuesday so that we can discuss this issue and get note written to the nursery so they can excuse him for not being potty trained any other parents going through or already gone through this issue how did you solve it thank you that lot to unpack think you need to phone your pediatrician and let them know what going on he seems delayed in communication skills which are important for potty training he may benefit from speech therapist or other early intervention techniques would recommend talking to your pediatrician before moving forward with daycare or potty training in the camp that if you want potty training to work it has to be positive experience punishing your child for wetting his pants by sitting him on the thing you want him to use willingly seems like the wrong message we used modified version of the oh crap method that has worked well for toddler that liked to hide when going to the bathroom and would rarely mention he had dirty diaper would definitely contact your ped to get him evaluated for speech delay just to add voice to all the other commenters your son needs an evaluation by developmental specialist several of these behaviors are red flags for further evaluation please try not to be upset with your son over this behavior until you have met with specialist this behavior could very likely be outside of his control lots of things say no communication skills at age 3y9m is significant delay not sure your location but in the us we have something called child find the public schools are required to handle the testing for all children over the age of 2y 11m this testing is free if you are here contact your local public school system and convey your concerns they will likely want to do full evaluation not just speech and language involving school psychologist for emotional behavioral cognitive and possibly an occupational therapist to consider other delays take your son to potty every hour reward your child for sitting on the potty larger reward for peeing on the potty and larger reward for pooping on the potty used stickers for sitting candy for peeing and toy cars for pooping you may find an activity that holds his attention to let him play with while on the potty make huge deal out of his success if he has an accident wets pants make no negative statement take his hand walk him to the potty and point pee goes in the potty walk him back to where accident happened and point at spot saying pee goes in the potty repeat this step times then sit him on potty for mins unless he fights sitting this is not reprimand or punishment totally neutral voice and face if he poops his pants clean him up and give him time on potty if he will try never make statement about pooping you do not want to accidentally cause him to withhold this is bad also don go back to nappies don confuse him this isn going to be easy may be long road but you got this momma maybe get undies with character he really likes and let him know paw patrol likes to stay dry don get him wet to keep him dry go pee pee in the potty get potty chair that is small enough for him to sit on unattended that he is comfortable on adult sized potties can be scary for little kids please stop the screen time now research shows the effects of screen time on neural development can mimic adhd emotional disturbance and autism it significantly delays speech development and hinders social communication can not stress this enough have tested many children who have delays related directly to this reach out to your pediatrician they may have resources for you please know that you aren alone there are many other parents out there with the same struggles potty training can be hard definitely visit with pediatrician and discuss your concerns with them as far as daycare don think your child will be potty trained in time and you shouldn rush potty training so finding another option will probably be less stressful for you and your child even with some guidance and gentle nudging from the parent children are ready when they are ready they are all different and they can be forced some kids easily take to using the toilet others take bit of time and lot of patience didn do any kind of day training with my kids so can speak to that but my advice would be to start with normalizing the bathroom talk if you don already do this before you even try to implement actual toilet training this is like setting the scene for him instead of making him the focus of going to the bathroom when you need to use the toilet announce it to him ex need to pee better go to the potty there are also board books about learning to use the potty that you can read to him each night before bed these acts introduce the concept without laying on the pressure he is little human still kind of new to this world—definitely new to controlling bodily functions that he probably isn really even aware that he has—so if your stress is directed at him he is going to feel it even more than you do it will have negative impact on his association with using the toilet and it will just make the process so much harder if he doesn talk much introduce hand signal still coupled with the verbal cues from you to indicate when you need to use the restroom sit with him and teach him the sign while simply explaining what it means not yet expecting that he will use it make these behaviors standard practice in your home until you have spoken with pediatrician and received the okay to begin potty training if they think your son may have developmental delay that could be aggravated by potty training they may advise laying off of it until further testing or milestones are reached am not health professional so could be wrong but think taking baby steps and seeking the advice of doctor is the best route can only speak from my own experience my son has delayed speech he now and still behind it does sound like you son has significant delay however how is his comprehension skills assuming health advisor will be looking into his speech and whatnot but if your looking for other sources if you re in the states at this age you can make an appointment with your school district to get him assed they ll have speech therapist talk with him and if he is behind enough which would be yes in your case most likely they ll set him up with class teacher intervention therpist to help him improve before him entering into kindergarten this is what they did for my son this service is free with the *public* school system if your not in the states you might still have similar service available and it would be worth looking into as far as potty training goes the average for boys is between and so he not technically behind have you tried naked potty training know it sounds silly but it worked with my son we took off his pants and let him around the house without diaper we put potty in the living room and potty in the bathroom for him when he did make it to the potty we made him clean up his own mess we got him gloves and helped too but that was the punishment when he did make it to the potty we made huge deal out of it lots of highfives and gummy bear between not having diaper to mess in and the potty celebrating he got the hang of it in about weeks then we moved to using pull up then to undies there were still accidents but it was much easier than the other ways we tried what is the oh crap method was one of those stubborn kids would not potty train so my mom put me back in diapers and decided to would try again later when she is busy or dealing with pregnancy and new baby fast forward to two weeks after my brother was born saw the mess he did in his diaper and my grandma explained he is baby so he poops in them and am big girl figured out was too old to be wearing them because saw what baby looked like maybe your son needs to be around babies and see their messy diapers to figure it out was also language delayed and could talk is he also around other kids his age perhaps he needs role models and peer pressure to be out of diapers he will see none of them wear diapers have you tried little potty in the room that he spends time in had one that did like to be in the potty by himself and could always sit there with him siblings and stuff so we put kid potty in the corner for him to sit on also his siblings would hang out with him while he was in the potty and tell him how awesome he was doing which madw him excited finally how long is the nursery school for my friend had problems with her daughter and accidents and spoke with the school and they were helpful even though it was against policy maybe if you send him in pull up and tell them they do need to change him but to call you to come and get him if he poops or has wet through then just take him home early for the day can you teach him how to change pull ups so he can change them at school if he pees then maybe just pick him up if he poops it is perfect solution but being around other kids his age using the potty and talking more might benefit him hope things go well for you guys definitely will seeing health visitor on tuesday so hopefully they give some support thank you for the answer much appreciated of course booked an appointment with the health visitor hopefully they can liaise with the nursery funnily enough it the same nursery that work at lot of the kids there can not talk but they at least know what the toilet is what they do there and when they need to go there some kids do even tell me and make their own way there glad good parents worry about their children and seek answers you are on the right track just by asking this question you re amazing my son is getting to the point of potty training and did know anything beyond taking them to the potty and rewarding them your method sounds awesome actually worked on this issue with number of families it definitely not easy and sure very frustrating if you need him to be trained asap but try to stay as calm as possible the first thing would say is do force it if you try to make it fight it might just upset the process more especially if he hurting himself on the potty maybe try sitting him on it when neither of you is upset with favorite toy or book and see if you can get him comfortable just sitting on it if possible try dumping diaper waste into the toilet and showing him that where pee poop goes read books about it cheer on or give little prizes to other family members when they go etc all these things will help get him started help him understand what you want also second those who have recommend bringing in speech therapist to help him communicate better this can help with so many frustrations they may even be able to help with the potty training depending on where you are many public schools will start kids at if they need help catching up to peers and know many of them will help with potty training as well good luck this was what did when my son was and non verbal getting the school district to assess him was very helpful he qualified for the developmental preschool where he received speech therapy and ot he also did need to be potty trained to attend and they provided transportation he was really frustrated with his lack of expressive speech receptive was fine and this would cause huge meltdowns started using signing time dvds and this really helped him he picked it up so quickly he could make his mouth say the words later dx with apraxia of speech but he could learn to sign them this greatly reduced his frustration and over time as he learned to say the words then he would drop the signs thank you for the answer unfortunately in england not the usa ll try to find out if any such scheme exists however do know that health visitors are available for support until the age of think so that will be helpful the issue is he will never tell me when he is about to pee sometimes he will sit right in front of me and do it and ca tell because there no sign it only when see his wet trousers and he gets uncomfortable that find out and when make him sit on the toilet we have got potty anymore think threw it out years ago nothing happens because he already peed would love to use cartoon characters to encourage him but he does understand even repeated the sentence peppa does pee pee in the **toilet** about dozen times but he just sits there and laughs and as for screen time wholeheartedly agree with you it is good but in house with one boy in college and two boys in secondary school you ll find phones tablets and laptops everywhere my son will spend about an hour or two on the sofa watching peppa pig on his tablet and then spend some time on the phone or laptop he loves going for walks outside so nag my other sons to take him every now and then all my sons grew up with electronics the first four were all using computers in nursery and knew how to operate word and the like before any of the other kids not too sure if that good thing though actually gave up few hours ago and made him wear pullups maybe another day but nevertheless thank you so much for your support will do thank you for the support ve heard that there book about potty training called oh crap could you tell me what the method is much appreciated would say average he will understand when tell him to eat go sleep have milk he knows the concept of charging phone he will ask look for my phone etc if say to him let go toilet he will understand me and shake his head and say no sometimes do want to push past that because he can get really aggressive scratching himself quite hard and banging his head making him walk around naked or just in pullups sounds like good idea although it will be hard to keep an eye on him since diabetic and ca walk around too much without getting exhausted and recently refurbished the living room so would want him to go there but ll definitely consider the idea thank you ooh that good idea there were actually some times when go to the toilet and he comes in too ll definitely be considering that idea since it ll make it more familiar to him and totally the last thing would want him to be is scared of the toilet actually had an incident last year where he accidentally put some cleaning spray in his eyes he was terrified of the doctors giving him about seven eye washes and definitely did cooperate when tried to bathe him months later he ok now though thank you for the answer my nephew did talk til he was older than but that because when they finally started looking into it they realized he had incredibly plugged ears and could actually hear anything anyone said since he got those fixed and with some extra one on one training with specialist his language has exploded along with his ability to follow commands moral of story you never know why child is talking and recommend getting some professionals involved to figure out what going on before trying to strong arm him into potty training if you can keep journal of when he pees you see pattern and just sit him on the toilet at that time use the journal and check him every 20 mins and notate when he dry or wet right now he doesn know what dry vs wet feels like identify this to him are you dry yes yay you are dry then when he is wet you say are you dry no you are not dry this way he learns dry is what want to be once you have the journal pulled up and see when he going sit him down mins before and male potty time special add to the list of having him watch his brothers use the toilet then he sees it as both normal thing and positive so it does sound like his comprehension is at good place which is awesome how his ears my pediatrician suggested that my sons speech delay was result of chronic ear infections he had as baby infections between 9months and 15 months we had to get tubes put in the pediatrician said that he was hearing words like they were being heard underwater so his speech reflected that and made him unwilling unable to pronounce words the scratching and banging could be result of frustration from not being able to tell you his needs or feelings properly my son got bit aggressive too he would hit himself hard it was heartbreaking honesty so know its hard to see your baby do that the naked potty training works for some not for others potty training my second right now and we are not using that method this time he peed in my fridge soooo yeah hear ya on it might not being possible potty training is pain maybe try skipping the sit down potty and let him go like big boy my oldest was soooo excited to go like daddy we got him stool to stand on and some toilet os for him to aim at he might like treating it like game anyway know it hard not to worry wish you the best your child engages in self injurous behavior sib is characteristic of autism as well as speech issues and lack of ability to communicate years old is still young enough to get helpful intervention but you need to take him to specialist asap for evaluation yeah that is something was particularly worried about in fact whenever he scratches himself out of anger have to pretend to be doctor and get the vaseline out and put bit on his arm and he stops having tantrum but will definitely bring that up with the health visitor thanks for the answer you should bring these concerns up with the pediatrician if you haven already he could have developmental delay or something else might be going on his hearing should be okay more often than not he will respond to me if call him when he upstairs or in different room actually already make him sit on the toilet but he more scared about it than excited but guess we ll try another day maybe with the support of his brothers thanks for the advice definitely he should be bit more comfortable with using the toilet if the others do so as well thanks for the comment ooh yes that is good idea will definitely be trying that out he actually just poo his nappy and does want me to change it ve noticed him recently being reluctant to change his nappy even if it just wet before he would have no issue with me changing his nappy in fact he would find it funny ll bring that up with the health visitor because it bit strange thanks for the comment you re absolutely right he will be checked out by the health visitor on tuesday so hopefully all goes well one recommendation always give my parents when potty training is keep moving forward this means never go back he might think you ll take his nappy away again he likes it it easy make it more fun without it and don give him the choice only use diaper at night and never use pull ups good luck hope this helps you re definitely right my other children were also late talkers but they were potty trained at so there something bit strange with this one but will be getting him checked out on tuesday thanks for the concern you re right perhaps should ve started toilet training much earlier but so much has gone on over the past year that totally forgot about it nonetheless ll try to make him ease out of wearing nappies over the next few days thanks again to make my son not scared of the toilet we had to find something he liked and let him do it while sitting on the toilet he would look at comic books and my husband and would read comics to him when he did finally go poo the entire family would sing you are the champion at the top of our lungs to him it was quite the production it took little time but the fear was gone completely after few months you need developmental pediatrician at this point the health visitor might be able to provide referral but this situation is above her pay grade it the oh crap potty training book it what used for my son too it essentially how to go diaper less and potty train in days to week it worked for my son but we ignored some of the book advice like the author says not to give treats for using the potty and we ignored that and bribed the heck out of my kid skittles for pee matchbox car for poop know the matchbox car seems excessive but they are only 98 cents and it worked so well from my kid after about 20 matchbox cars told him we didn have any more and he was cool with that work with autistic children so going to explain this because want to help you not saying fully understand your specific situation or casting any judgement when he tantrums you are positively reinforcing that maladaptive behavior by giving him the attention and love of putting vaseline on then he calms down so the next time he wants your attention or love he knows all have to do is tantrum and mom will come and give me the attention its just creating cycle ideally you would stop reinforcing the sib behavior and reinforce him when he displays any other alternative behaviors or in absense of the sib because your son engages in sib its that much more important to seek help so you can get behavior specialist to help create plan of action for when he engages in behaviors sib is serious and ve seen kids who severely hurt themselves simply because they are angry and cant communicate therapy can help your son to gain the skills to use replacement behavior for the sib lastly want you to know understand how difficult it is to have child with communication delays and sympathize with your struggles it so incredibly tough and you are doing great job reaching out to ask for help im happy to talk if you ever need you can always pm me could you get some help with your other sons like ask them to do the same announce that they are going to toilet and make some simple sign like two fingers down person walking or horizontal ok toilet hole to give the youngest idea that everyone is going to toilet is any of older boys role model for youngest maybe watching him would help suggest getting the book but among other things it states that you shouldn use underwear when potty training the kid should be completely naked the first one two days and then only have pants no underwear it feels too much like diaper http www jamieglowacki com all things potty training basically no pants or underwear for days pay super close attention and learn signals we went from diapers to boxers lots of praise for success we did small prizes for poop on the potty and stickers for pee oh crap is anti prizes the goal is to take them from oops peed to oh peeing to need to pee interesting ll try that out thanks for the suggestion yes that good idea think he enough of the toilet today but from now onwards ll get them to help thanks again never view it that way thank you so much for that insight he always having tantrums when take away the phone or tablet because he so emotionally attached to them have to quickly give it back or replace it with another item to get him to stop scratching is actually new thing he does before he used to bump his head on the floor really hard and he had quite few visible bumps due to this actually checked out this http www talkingpoint org uk progress checker progress checker for language development and was astonished at the different activities there were that he was yet doing reading book having chat asking questions etc ll certainly be bringing this up with the doctor thanks for the information wouldn listen quite yet to the people crying autism quite yet please don fret and just take it one step at time it very likely it nothing just stubborn boy in the case qualified professional sees something please still don fret one day at time you ve got this *hugs* go to your nearest easter seals and ask for an assessment he may qualify for eci which will help him with speech and occasional therapy best of luck did want to say it but yes it is red flag for autism with the right treatment she can help him develop accordingly know family that recognized the signs at years and he is really bright and social my year old is talking much yet either he baby talks the early intervebtion said developmentally he wasnt behind enough for therapy he was stubborn potty trainer too started leaving him without bottoms on for couple of days and he figured out he needed to use the potty chair he short so we started with that instead of the toilet hope all goes well for your little guy when you see the health visitor be sure to talk with his doctor about any of these concerns just thought but if he likes the phone and can understand it better than speech you might be able to find an app that helps encourage potty training like with games videos maybe even rewards have son with autism and have worked with children with autism for many years and disagree with some of this information tantrums and meltdowns are two different things if he is having meltdown with self injurious behavior he is not having function of getting moms attention meltdown is not manipulative and is something that can not be helped during meltdown moms love and support is greatly needed mom maybe your son has autism maybe he doesn you are going to get tons and tons of advice as parent but even more if you have child with special needs so here mine you know your kid you are the expert in your child don let anyone tell you you re not he needs to be assessed you know that and you will need some guidance along the way but nobody knows your baby like you do all we are doing is the best we can my son has high functioning autism and wasn successfully potty trained until right before he turned sensory issues are huge with some kids add that with communication difficulties and it makes things like potty training more difficult get him evaluated and figure that out first the rest will fall into place when he ready think you should be prepared to find out that your child may be on the spectrum being nonverbal at this age unaware uncaring of his bodily functions and stimming the scratching when upset are common issues with asd also what is your approach to potty training are you taking him to sit ever 30 minutes and providing light praise for trying there is no point in forcing him to sit on the potty after an incident he will only associate it with punishment calmly clean him up and redress him tell him it is okay because he is learning but he must pee poo in the potty use strikes policy for both of your sanity practice sitting and attempting to relieve oneself at bath and bed time regardless of having struck out earlier and thank light praise for trying upon success big praise reward appropriate to his likes if you think spoken language is problem try teaching him the sign for bathroom agreed friend of mine son wasn speaking or toilet trained at turns out it was physical issue with his tonsils and adenoids causing it one surgery fixed it he now speaks perfect coherent english and little of his second language completely toilet trained and is one of the brightest most social and inquisitive kids ve ever met slow start doesn automatically mean autism my daughter will be in october she is potty trained and we have been trying for months she only says handful of words and only few are pronounced clearly she has sensory processing disorder we started her in therapy for speech and occupational about year ago started with developmental therapist few months ago and she said she will go potty when she is ready and not to push the issue think kids learn at there own pace and when they feel comfortable would stress over it when they are ready they will found preschool that accepts kids not potty trained and had to call dozen just to find that one would say you should look into first steps but think that birth to would ask what other early intervention programs are available speech therapist would be able to evaluate him and determine if he is in need of services he might also qualify for ot or other services too think op is in the uk health visitor nappies etc so don think they have first steps definitely agree that some kind of developmental pediatrician and or early intervention services are definitely necessary this kid is my son age exactly my son who level autistic and far more verbal this mom should definitely be considering autism at this point this does sound like selective mutism it sounds like peeing through undies does bother him sensory and he self injuring if her kid ca talk at all as she saying big flag glad she escalating this and in the meantime she may want to contact the schools where she lives regarding any special education services he might be eligible for including preschools even if he is considered severe now he may be high functioning later on there are now realize several autistic people in my husband family op needs to hear it because lot of people in real life are ignorant or too polite to say something she can get him treatment and get the tools to handle his behaviors you have quite the challenge and wish you the best of luck and hopefully his issues are easily resolved and hope that when in situations like yours also can bring myself to reach out and ask for advice and experience didn mean to say her child definitely doesn have autism just that it could potentially be something else too the friend spoke of had her son screened for autism developmental delays everything and agree with you that it good idea for op to do the same sorry if pushed button or came across the wrong way personally allow pullups all day and he still uses the potty found when removed them the accidents stressed us both out and made training extra unpleasant rewarded just sitting on the potty every hour he wants to watch something well he got ta try to go pee first he wants yogurt then sit on the potty then rewards for peeing and pooing and now half the time he asks to go without being told reason with him too explain what is bad about accidents time wasted if he ca pee on the potty set timer for 20 40 minutes later and try again remember that if you show excitement he will too high fives and smiles every time he goes in the potty build his self esteem mine also had period where he would tell me he had an accident but made sure clean up time wasnt fast and would talk about how much faster we be back playing if he pee in the potty and remind him when it time to go pee again that peeing in the potty can be fast like when mommy and daddy go pee then it back to playing yay it ok if he laughs at your encouragement laughing on the potty can help him relax as long as he can understand the reasoning for using the potty and how it something all adults and big kids do even kitty poos in her litter box he ll learn it normal it not want to its have to and it can be quick and easy and make you feel better hi have found pretty best training for you it is related to potty training here https tricks tips you can get video hope it will help you if you want to get full video then click on affiliate link below video for training am aware from your problems and hope you will soon feel happy and fine best of luck not mad at ya admittedly in my situation was surrounded by people talking away my concerns or outright telling me my fears were wrong wish someone else had been so afraid of autism earlier and given it to me straight just think it easy sometimes to fall into denial and do want that to happen to someone else my stepson was autistic he didn smile or laugh didn make eye contact and didn have much of personality other than what wanted ups describe as uncomfortable screaming only thomas the tank would stop the tears he didn interact with the outside world much at all know autism is spectrum but we are not in position to be making armchair diagnoses for this woman telling her that she may want to seek pediatrician guidance is one thing but making her scared and throwing around diagnoses is not helpful if it helps you feel any better my son just recently got fully trained at and half just under the wire for pre like no joke with one week to spare he also almost never talked and we sought early intervention for his speech and while he can talk it is always infrequent and brief we went with the timing method for potty and he eventually mastered that but poop was massive issue he is incredibly stubborn and strong willed our end success was literally timing his poop schedule and just getting close to that point and making him take off all of his bottoms and that is how he stayed in his room with be supervising so he could hide he eventually relented and pooped though he did scream like he was being murdered visited the health visitor today who did some weight and height checkups everything was good there she told me that the nursery can not refuse to take my son on the basis of him not being potty trained so should just send him with spare change of clothes and they will have to deal with him if he does wet himself plus around other kids who will most likely not be potty trained he can learn from and play with them meanwhile she referred us to speech and language therapist to help with his speech development no mention of autism yet but she did say that it would ve been much better to see the health visitor few months ago since getting an appointment with an slt could take some time thank you so so much to all those who commented truly appreciate the support you ve given me and will remember to let you know for any updates so glad getting that support is huge good for you for seeking it out
